ratings.comment: Bad professor. Horrible to communicate with, lacks any understanding for students.

Awful man, courses rely too much on lectures, and the lectures have irrelevant information.
He is very unprofessional, exams might have topics that were literally briefly mentioned during the lectures.
Also, he doesnt provide any practice questions for exams, thus, you do not know what to expect on the exams/midterms

Lecture heavy class, lots of readings too. His lectures were somewhat interesting but could get boring at times. We had a semester long group project worth 40% of our grade which wasn't the best. This class also had very few assignments so you had to do fairly well on them all or you were screwed.

Really enjoyed this class and this prof, but you 100% have to go to lecture as there is basically no info on the slides, meaning if you miss class a lot, you miss a majority of the info. Labs are very easy as he gives you exact instructions (basically free points), and the midterms/final are relatively easy if you go to class and do the readings!

Slides had barely any information so you have to go to lecture in order to get the information. Labs are super easy, midterms are easy if you go to class and take notes. The syllabus makes him seem super scary but the class is not bad at all.

I can confidently say that Prof. Parker has been the best professor I've had through a year at this school. Though his slides can be messy at times, he gives you all the information you need to do well. Labs are basically free points as long as you do them, and midterms/final are tough but as long as you take notes you'll be fine.

One of the best lecturers I have had at UW. His lectures are incredibly engaging, but he doesn't allow computers so be prepared to hand write as he's talking (and his slides are kind of unorganized -- most info comes verbally, but he doesn't talk too fast). The discussion work and labs are super easy. Exams are easy if you pay attention in class.

He definitely can be a bit much at times, but overall Parker is great. He cares the most out of any other Political Science professor I've had yet, and that just adds to the experience in the class. He is hilarious and makes the content as interesting as possible. If there's one thing I can say about his lectures, it's that you will never be bored.

I genuinely don't understand why people don't like this guy. Lectures aren't that hard if you take notes on what he says, not what's on the board. He is by far the funniest professor I've had so far. He is not condescending or ruse at all, especially if you try. Don't let bad reviews discourage you from taking him, he is an amazing professor.

He loves to ramble about his own opinion during lectures. Sometimes it's funny to hear how biased he is, but it starts to get old when its every single class. I did not study much at all other than doing the readings. The exams were doable if I had studied. There are some chances for extra credit. The "labs" in class are easy.
Very engaging lecturer and uses good examples to make concepts easy to understand.

I can see why a lot of people dislike Parker, he could be rude at times. Though, I actually really liked him. If you prepare by doing the readings, he puts everything together nicely. The lectures, however, can be hard to follow because his slides are unorganized, and sometimes he just talks and talks without slides. Take good Notes and study.

Lots of students dislike Professor Parker, because he requires students to come to lecture and take notes. If you come to lecture and pay attention, you will see that he provides you with all of the information to succeed and more. He's very witty, provides great examples, and was my favorite professor last semester. He was a joy to have.

Overall, I liked Professor Parker as a lecturer and never found him condescending or rude. He made the class engaging, although his political stances may have distorted some of his messages. I enjoyed PS104, even if it was lecture-heavy and required a lot of reading. The midterms and final are difficult but doable with some studying.

If there is one thing you take away from this, DO NOT take a class with professor parker. He discusses personal opinions as though they are fact and shares an uncomfortable amount about his personal life. He seems to take off an arbitrary amount of points with no feedback. I'm a poli sci major and this is the worst experience i've had with a prof

Shares his (strong) opinions way too often, and that's coming from someone who tends to agree with him. His lectures are hard to follow and the slides almost make it more confusing. He would constantly talk badly about the students at his last job, rambling about how we were so much smarter than them and it put a bad taste in my mouth.

This guy was the worst. I'm a poli sci major... after this class im not sure.  He was extremely biased, shared way too personal details, and made the whole class about his lectures which were messy at best.  Poor TA's just wanted us to pass and to help but he was so rude to them even they disliked him.

Like the other review said, he's condescending, RUDE, and unapproachable. It's not impossible to get an A if you read the textbook, go to lecture, and study, but the exam averages were all in the 70s. His lectures are very hard to follow, he rants constantly and will mumble important details. Exam MCQs pull from random snippets of his lectures.

He's a nice guy and I had a good semester, but he's got huge red flags. It doesn't seem like he loves teaching. Is moody, condescending; its hard to ask questions. Overshares from his personal life. If you take him, pay extra attention in class (tough lectures) and seek help from fellow students. There's a lot to learn, but keep your distance.

Eh,the exams are doable if you attend lectures and do the readings. Lectures aren't "technically" required but it's in your best interest to go. He is extrememly unapproachable. I asked him a very reasonable question about one of the confusing Excel labs, and he made me feel like I was an idiot. Heard he is rude to his TAs, who are very helpful.

Parker was an entertaining lecture for sure. He didn't allow computers in class which was annoying because he talks so fast so everything had to be hand written. He doesn't actually take attendance in lecture but discussions are mandatory. Exams are lecture heavy, so if you miss a lecture you will not do very well on test.

Parker is isn't a great professor. I've been told that he doesn't even make his own tests. The tests are IMPOSSIBLE to study for, and he doesn't give any practice/example questions, so you don't know what to expect. 90% of questions are probably what he mentioned once in lecture (if he even mentioned them). Class is impossible. Take someone else

Parker is passionate about his work and cares about the course material, but he's extremely unprofessional. He overshares too much about his personal life and creates an uncomfortable learning environment. He is also very strict with grading, condescending during class, and difficult to approach. Do not take his class!
